item.title: One up 0.4
item.description:
One up : 0.4

Some days have passed, some code has been written, removed, rewritten, removed and rewritten. And we (yes, I had some help this time) are quite happy to release Mjölk 0.4. Still a beta, with probably some bugs here and there but it’s a big leap forward as two big features have been added :

- followers and followed users
- users groups

This is definetly not finished since the interface needs improvements, interconnections with some other services etc …

So now we need some feedback, some bug reports : fiddle around and send us some feedback (on anything : design, features, bugs, …) then pass the link to someone you know and who might be interested. There is still room for beta testers.

Thanks to madprog and neuro` for handy feedback and advices on code and design.

item.title: One Up 0.3.2
item.description:
One Up : 0.3.2

I could not resist the urge to code in order to fix some cache trouble and improve some other parts. So … 0.3.2 is out.

See Changelog for details.

item.title: API Rdoc
item.description:
API Rdoc

After the work done on the api it’s only logical to publish the doc to use it. It’s available on the github wiki and at rdoc.info.

For the moment only 5 over 15 methods are implemented. All 5 are in the posts section, the ones missing are mostly tags related. So be patient or get in to bring those to life.

As said in the wiki, the api is based on the Delicious API to make it easier to port, develop clients or libs. We also think it’s really simple, clean and efficient, so why not use it ?

item.title: One up v0.3.1
item.description:
One up : v0.3.1

Beta release v0.3.1 is out and running. It features some interesting changes :

  • api support with basic http auth (more on this later, check the rdoc v1/posts)
  • fix the bookmarks deletion process when a user is deleting his account

You can check the Changelog on github.

As always, you are most welcome to comment, test, post issues.

item.title: Mjölk goes beta and live
item.description:
Mjölk goes beta and live

Hello everyone, this is first post of the Mjölk blog. Mjölk is a bookmarking engine licensed under MIT to bring a simple alternative to some big names.

Mjölk is swedish for milk.

It was mainly started to provide a safe harbor after the Delicious rumors. The goal was to create something that will be easily managed and perpetuated in all situations. But now it’s somehow different with a code base growing quickly and some ideas running.

We are working a lot to finish the first set of functionnalities but already there the really basic ones : bookmark with tags, tag clouds, private bookmarks.

The registration is open, with a 42 beta testers quota. After that (about 30 seats left right now) we will lock any new accounts until we finish some stages.

Until then some news will come here.
